title: The 1984 Annual World's Best SF
text:
The 1984 Annual World's Best SF is an <a href="anthology">anthology</a> of <a href="science%20fiction">science fiction</a> short stories edited by <a href="Donald%20A.%20Wollheim">Donald A. Wollheim</a> and <a href="Arthur%20W.%20Saha">Arthur W. Saha</a>, the thirteenth volume in a <a href="The%20Annual%20World%E2%80%99s%20Best%20SF">series</a> of nineteen. It was first published in paperback by <a href="DAW%20Books">DAW Books</a> in June 1984, followed by a hardcover edition issued in August of the same year by the same publisher as a selection of the <a href="Science%20Fiction%20Book%20Club">Science Fiction Book Club</a>. For the hardcover edition the original cover art by <a href="Vincent%20Di%20Fate">Vincent Di Fate</a> was replaced by a new cover painting by <a href="Richard%20Powers">Richard Powers</a>.
The book collects ten novellas, novelettes and short stories by various science fiction authors, with an introduction by Wollheim. The stories were previously published in 1983 in the magazines "<a href="Analog%20Science%20Fiction%20and%20Fact">Analog Science Fiction/Science Fact</a>", "<a href="Asimov%27s%20Science%20Fiction">Isaac Asimov's Science Fiction Magazine</a>", "<a href="Amazing%20Stories">Amazing Science Fiction</a>", and "<a href="The%20Magazine%20of%20Fantasy%20%26amp%3B%20Science%20Fiction">The Magazine of Fantasy & Science Fiction</a>", and the anthology "<a href="Chrysalis%2010">Chrysalis 10</a>".
Awards.
The anthology placed sixth in the 1984 <a href="Locus%20Award">Locus Poll Award for Best Anthology</a>.
"Blood Music" won the 1983 <a href="Nebula%20Award%20for%20Best%20Novelette">Nebula Award for Best Novelette</a>.and the 1984 <a href="Hugo%20Award%20for%20Best%20Novelette">Hugo Award for Best Novelette</a>, placed fourth in the 1984 <a href="Locus%20Award">Locus Poll Award for Best Novelette</a>, and was nominated for the 1984 <a href="SF%20Chronicle%20Award%20for%20Best%20Novelette">SF Chronicle Award for Best Novelette</a>.
"Potential" placed sixteenth in the 1984 <a href="Locus%20Award">Locus Poll Award for Best Short Story</a>.
"Spending a Day at the Lottery Fair" placed third in the 1984 <a href="Locus%20Award">Locus Poll Award for Best Short Story</a>.
"In the Face of My Enemy" was nominated for the 1984 <a href="Hugo%20Award%20for%20Best%20Novella">Hugo Award for Best Novella</a> and placed tenth in the 1984 <a href="Locus%20Award">Locus Poll Award for Best Novella</a>.
"The Leaves of October" was nominated for the 1983 <a href="Analog%20Award%20for%20Best%20Novella/Novelette">Analog Award for Best Novella/Novelette</a>.
"Homefaring" was nominated for the 1983 <a href="Nebula%20Award%20for%20Best%20Novella">Nebula Award for Best Novella</a> and the 1984 <a href="SF%20Chronicle%20Award%20for%20Best%20Novella">SF Chronicle Award for Best Novella</a>, and placed fourth in the 1984 <a href="Locus%20Award">Locus Poll Award for Best Novella</a>.
